Articles.Content:
This ship will get you anywhere you want to go, except back home as it includes no parachutes.

It\'s very stable, very powerful, and has a lot of fuel to burn.

I recommend not going over 1 tick past 1/3rd throttle on the first stage unless you like big explosions...and really, you do not need more than that.
Why on earth do you have so many ASAS? That\'s a waste of mass...

Because I haven\';\'t changed it from my initial design?

Because it doesn\'t matter would be the likeliest response though, the extra mass does not in any way hinder the ship, hitting minimus you\'ll be dropping off an almost full tank on the second stage, just leaving it to float in orbit.

This is made for going to other planets, and it explodes less with the asas\'s.
Remove all but one ASAS, and attach some clamps and you\'re good.

I\'m fine with it tbh. I think anyone trying it out will realize the extra mass makes no difference, the first stage is enough all by itself to give you very nice orbit.

One tank on the second stage is enough to get you to Minimus, a half of the second tank is enough to make a nice orbit that is directly in line with Minimus, you won\'t even touch the third.

Obviously whatever anyone wants to do with it after they download it is just fine.

But I\'m fine with it as is for now.
You do not need more than one ASAS. You\'re fine with SAS, though.

I have made some standard improvements (weight reduction, improved strength and reliability) and posted an improved version. Can take off at full throttle, no chance of explosions, and all but one ASAS removed (since more than 1 has no effect anyways).

Enjoy!
I do not see taking off at full throttle as an improvement tbh. lol

Add parachutes (2-3) radially to the top of the capsule, just below where it meets the RSC tanks and ASAS. If the weight of 12 ASASs really makes no difference, three chutes won\'t harm performance at all.

Add parachutes (2-3) radially to the top of the capsule, just below where it meets the RSC tanks and ASAS. If the weight of 12 ASASs really makes no difference, three chutes won\'t harm performance at all.

It\'s my version of a stock parts base, it was never meant to return.
